document.title: Accolades, Fall 2011

author.organization: College of Education, Health, and Human Sciences

document.abstract: In this issue of Accolades, you will learn about some of the wonderful work in which our students and faculty are engaging. As you know, the college motto is “Enhancing Quality of Life through Research, Outreach, and Practice,” and most of the stories contained herein truly embrace this mission. In particular, please take the time to read about how two of our doctoral students in the Department of Kinesiology, Recreation, and Sport Studies are addressing the needs of refugees who have resettled in Knoxville from war-torn Iraq. You will also learn about students who moved their doctoral seminar class to Brussels and Paris.
